alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties through 500 PM MDT/600 PM CDT/... At 424 PM MDT/524 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. The environment is capable of producing brief landspout tornadoes. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wichita, southeastern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
